title: Klyde Warren Park photos
text:
Klyde Warren Park opened on top of Woodall Rodgers Freeway in October 2012.

Phase 2 of the park, expanding it west, was put on hold when the lowest bid for the deck in January 2022 was $95 million, 101% above the $47.2 million estimate. The bid was rejected due to high cost. A rebid of the deck job is currently slated to receive bids in August 2024 (but bidding dates are always subject to change).

The $10 million Nancy Best Fountain on the east end of the park opened on September 14, 2022.

images.caption: Looking east across the park lawn.
The lawn grass was in the restoration mode in May 2014.
The walkway with arches on the south side.
The walkway with arches on the north side.
Food trucks along the Woodall Rodgers Freeway eastbound frontage road.
The Nancy Best fountain opened on the east end of the park on September 14, 2022. It is mainly intended as a water play area for children, and also has a fountain show in the evening.
The McKinney Avenue trolley passes through the park on Olive Street.
In September 2022 work was in progress to expand the children's playground area
